Reviews.Title: “Service beyond par”
Reviews.Author: Karuna A
Reviews.Content: The owner of this hotel is extremely helpful. On the train to Rome during a trip with my husband and in-laws, my husband discovered that he had incorrectly booked our rooms and called the hotel to sort out the situation. The owner was extremely understanding and immediately tried to do what he could to accommodate us and ensured that we had enough rooms to stay for the duration of our trip. He shifted us to the hotel apartments for the last two days of our stay and these were one of the nicest ones I've stayed in plus they were extremely well priced. So I'd highly recommend checking out the Cortina apartments as well. The hotel itself is small but extremely well located, within walking distance to Termini station, Trevi fountain, the Spanish steps and other cultural highlights. The hotel also helped us book a guide for the Vatican and he was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisFamily3
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely three nights at Hotel Cortina. The staff was wonderful - friendly and helpful. The location is great - close to the train station and walking distance to everywhere but the Vatican (but metro train stop is on the corner and we actually did end up meandering back) The breakfast was nice - very attentive and about what you expect in Italy. The Irish pub downstairs was fun and the noise was not a problem at all. Yes, the rooms and the shower are small - but they all are in Italy - so just expect that and you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki N
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the apartment for 3 nights, It was perfect, clean, spacious and comfortable( i only wish we could have stayed longer). Angelo and his staff were very professional, friendly and very happy to be of service. we really couldn't ask for better! The location is very accessible to everything. I would love to return again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Regina N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cortina in Apt. A for three nights. The rooms were beautiful, clean, and the perfect accommodation for our family of five. Mr. Milano and his staff were most gracious and helpful. We appreciated the internet access, breakfast in the morning, and the espresso maker in the kitchen. The bathrooms are modern and were stocked with soap, shampoo and a blow dryer. The location is a ten minute walk to the Termini Metro station, and a half hour walk to the Colosseum. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Carolynn M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Cortina for 7 nights and it was a very positive experience. The room was very pretty. On the negative, the tub leaked but they knew this and an absorbent towel did the job. A bit of a weak flush to the toilet, though. Room very, very clean. We had a room on an outside wall and it is very noisy with the roar of the traffic on the Nationale. With ear plugs, it was fine. The mattress and pillow were wonderful. The staff were exceptional - very friendly, warm and helpful. The breakfast was very good although for improvement I would suggest real juice, not 'fruit punch'. The rolls were excellent although one day they were dry/old. There is a sign on the sidewalk pointing to the entrance. It is not what you expect. It points to a big wooden door. Just push the buzzer and they will let you in. Take the wee elevator (if you have luggage) to the first floor and the reception desk and rooms are there. Excellent location to the metro, train station and the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: jenniferj123
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Rome, largely due to this lovely little hotel. The staff were very friendly and made sure we were comfortable. The men on reception were always happy to answer any questions (and we had a lot) and recommend places to see and eat. We were given a large, clean room with a spacious bathroom and although the hotel is near a busy road, we didn’t hear a thing when the window was closed. The breakfast is simple but lovely and you can help yourself to as much as you want while you tea/coffee is constantly being topped up. The location is great, we walked mostly all over Rome, but it is close to the main train station. We had arranged to be picked up from the airport through the hotel, which worked well and although this is more expensive than other ways of getting into the centre, we were glad this was arranged before we arrived (we got the train back to the airport). All in all, great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Friendly !”
Reviews.Author: AlpacaKanagawa
Reviews.Content: We three persons stayed at Apartment B for 5 nights in February to March. The apartment is very clean and comfortable (e.g enough space, hot shower, nice beds, espresso machine). It's close to Termini station & bus stop and is very convenient to visit almost famous place. We could also had a fresh new day with nice cappuccino, fresh cheese, hum, breads at Hotel's breakfast. Of special note is Angelo's friendly service. Before stay there, he did replied my e-mail(lots of questions!) quickly & politely. Angelo supported for our first stay at Rome by sharing the information of sightseeing and restaurants. Thank you very much Angel and we are sure we will stay there again when we visit to Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: garythestokefan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for a 4 night stay during 1st week of march room 2. Found the hotel in an excellent location to all attractions in rome only 7-10 minute walk from the bus/train station and easy to find. The reception staff all male we saw 3 at different times of the day were very very efficient and polite.The breakfast was a very good standard continental type cheeses,hams,rolls,cereals,yogerts the staff replemish the food at frequent times and ask if you like tea or coffee etc. The room we had was very good size very large cumfy bed, good clean bathroom the staff cleaned the room every day we were there.The hotel entance is on a main road you have to press a button/buzzer on the outside wall to gain access through the large wooden door way (electronic lock) we never had to wait longer than a few second for the member of staff on duty to release the lock. Good selection of shops and restaraunts very close by and although on a main road the noise is quite distant as the rooms all face a side street and church.The hotel is on the 1st floor of the building above a irish pub but was this was not a problem with noise during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ela24022012
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near Termini station and metro stops. Being on the main street it is also safe for single travelers to arrive late. The room was very clean and elegant. The staff was wonderful and very helpful and I will return there definitely for my next Roman holiday. Just great!

Reviews.Title: “Correction for my previous review...Staff & location should be 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: R M
Reviews.Content: There is a typo in my previous review, the service, location & value should be 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Best choice, I've been coming here 11 years”
Reviews.Author: G G
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cortina is an excellent choice, maybe one of the best in Rome, and for budget minded travelers; most of us fall into this group. This place is my favorite as it really gives you everything easy. Via Nazionale is close to Termini, the main train station, but away from the somewhat gritty section immediately close to it. The walk to Hotel Cortina is about 7-10 minutes, located on one of the main downtown arteries. Immediate close to the place is lots of clothes shopping, the non- touristic shops, where the locals go, but yet in the heart of Rome, and only about a 15-20 minute walk to the main sites of the city ! The area is quite safe, and there is even an Irish Pub directy adjacent to the Hotel. I can not imagine a better location for a hotel ! The famous American travel writer Rick Steves, wrote up about this place and he has included it in his travel books. The staff is very friendly, I can tell you that in the 11 years that I have been coming here, most of the staff has not changed, I only see the same faces and this gives me a great sense of trust. Tip: I highly reccommend staying in their apratments (just around the corner), for the most value--check it out from their main website--. You get a spacious apartment in Rome for about the same price completely furnished and newly remodled which includes a kitchen, etc..It trully feels like your home in Rome ! Also, the hotels offers a car service to the airport that is one of the most resonable prices I've seen. Some useful info on transportation: we spent about 10 Euros on our trips back late at night, I find that very reaonable. The bus can be taken directly in front of the hotel or better yet the metro is located about 4 minutes away too. I reccomend walking the most though, it's a pleasure in Rome. Stay here and avoid the Bull S#%4 of other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Irish1Australia
Reviews.Content: We visit Rome for 5 nights in January 2012 and this Hotel was a great find. Central to everything and the staff were very helpful with adviseand suggestions. They even arranged transport for us to the airport at the end of our stay. The hotel is small 15 rooms, and typical of Rome on the first floor of a building hidden behind one of the may doors. The breakfast was included and was sufficient for us. Next door is a Irish pub so after a long day exploring we ended up having a drink in the pub. For thse who need an internet cafe whildt travelling then just 100m around the corner is a good one for you. The food in Rome was only one word for ir "fantastic" find where the local eat and you will not be disapointed both with quality and price! The hotel is only 15min walk to Termni station. Language was not a problem the staff spoke english. Grat value for money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: AlexNI
Reviews.Content: Arrived late in evening and a bit concerned with entrance to hotel. Our fears were allayed once we reached 1st floor & hotel entrance. Good sized room with 3 beds although only two of us. Spacious bathroom.Good quality furnishings & spotless. Air conditioning a must even during the cold spell that we experienced. I couldn't believe how quiet the hotel was even though we were right in the centre. Mini bar/ fridge good size. Quaint breakfast room with sufficient food to set you up for the day. The main selling point for the hotel would be the staff. they are so friendly & helpful and assisited with planning our routes on a daily basis. No problem either with leaving our bags all day due to late departure. Fantastic location for Termini station and all tourist attractions within walking distance. This was our first time to Rome but wouldn't hesitate to come back to this hotel or their apartments. Excellent value for money. Would recommend bringing a travel kettle as no facilities at hotel for this.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mish02
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel on our trip to Rome. Although there was 2 of us we were put in a triple room and therefore it was quite spacious. The room was clean and nice polished floor boards. The bathroom had an amazing large shower head over the bath. It did take a long while for the water to heat up but might have been because Rome was going through its freezing cold snap... Breakfast was basic but the breakfast room was super cute. Staff was friendly. Good for 3 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean!!!!”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at end of jan 2012,amazing location.At the heart of tourist rome and a stroll to all sites.Service and hygene 100% ,breakfast filling and well layed out,room small but all that required (room 3),shower hot and powerful.Overall a great find and perfect base camp for tour of city. All staff looked and sounded the part,even gave me a loan of a phone charger.I would send anyone to here and sure they would be happy with standards.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cortina”
Reviews.Author: esra k
Reviews.Content: Very close to main terminal of Rome. (About 5 minutes walk) On a main street. Clean, bright, silent and comfortable rooms, friendly and very gentleman staff, delicious breakfast. If i go to Rome again, i'd prefer this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy apartment in heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Careymax
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in both apartments and hotel room on three occasions now and would not even bother to look any where else. Hotel very quaint and apartments a luxury treat for a fraction of the cost. Great location, safe, clean and host Angelo a great help. As an Austrlian I am very fussy and used to large modern accommodation. The apartments I'll not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: p g
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near the Termini station, subway, shopping, and sights (grocery store is on the next block, too). Although the hotel lobby is one flight up, there is an elevator. The staff at Hotel Cortina was friendly, efficient, and helpful. Good breakfast, excellent capuccino! We definitely would stay again and recommend the hotel as an excellent value. For dining, try the Due Colonne at Via dei Serpenti, 91. Excellent food at reasonable prices. For an after-dinner drink, try the Strega Bar just around the corner. Friendly staff and inexpensive digestifs.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Sean L
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them. We liked breakfast which was so fresh and great start to the day. The room was clean and comfortable. I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Apartment in Rome”
Reviews.Author: traceywindley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Cortina as a single traveller five years ago, and had a wonderful experience. My host Angelo was most helpfull and polite to assist me with suitable plans to tour the city. This time I experienced the new apartments, which were just amazing. They are actually as good as the photos (which is not usually the case on web sites!). The apartment is perfectly located withing walking distance to most sights and transport. The apartment is very clean, modern with luxurious beds and bedding, modern bathroom, and the finer details such as coffee maching, sewing kits, laptop, books and magazines give it the little bit extra to make a warm and comfortable stay. I travel a lot for business and holiday, and can honestly say this is a perfect place to stay for both types of travellers. Angelo was even so kind to assist when I needed an additional nights accommodation when my itinerary changed, and also assisted my friend who came back the following week.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a find in Roma....”
Reviews.Author: Lisabpac
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a great location, excellent customer service, and their attention to detail is wonderful. The hotel is quaint, clean,homey and the breakfast buffet was very good. The only downside for us was the very firm bed, but this seemed to be the norm in Italy! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Annie72
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Cortina once or twice a year for the last 12 years. The hotel and staff have been perfect each time. We love the apartments and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BartRusli
Reviews.Content: the staff is really amaze us...beside the location is also convenient to explore rome..seriously i will forget all about the tiny room, the small tv...the staff is awesome! thank you!! i love rome n sure will come back

Reviews.Title: “Not a great stay.....”
Reviews.Author: zzzzzz___tt
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms (one for 4 persons and the other for 2 persons). The one with 4 persons basically was a room for two with two extra beds!!! (there was no room to walk between the beds and the room was really tight). When we book a room for 4 we expect a slight bigger room than the room for two!!! No kettle in the room and when we asked for hot water for drinking they would not assist or even attempt to help us!! (saying that the hot water machine was shut down). one of the staff (not the owner) was VERY RUDE and should be sacked!!! He scolded us for taking too many maps (we took 4 maps for 6 adults). The only okay things were that the place was genally clean and the breakfast was good for a small hotel. WOULD NOT stay here for groups of 4 PERSONS in one room!!!! (for two persons it is okay)

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: lmft414
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last month and had an excellent experience. As other mentioned, the location was fabulous - we walked everywhere. The staff was extremely helpful, and the room was clean and quiet. We were able to open the window without noise problems, which was fortunate, since the room was quite warm. Breakfast was very good. The only slight difficulty we had was that the doorknob to our room didn't work well, and we had trouble getting into and out of the room. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Italia11-25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cortina in July, 2011. Our stay was amazing. The hotel was in a great location, central to many attractions. The rooms were lovely as well. The only two things we would like to see improved : 1) Breakfast selections could be increased a bit; 2) It would be nice if a cafe was available for after hours. Once breakfast is no longer served, there really is no place to go or sit at the hotel, even for a coffee or latte. Otherwise, everything from the staff to the service, etc, was wonderful. We will definately return !!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, attentive staff, good apartment”
Reviews.Author: ITTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 'Apartment A' which is just around the corner from the main hotel. The location is in central Rome off Via Nazionale, fairly close to Termini and just down from Piazza Repubblica with its Metro. Its within walking distance (20-30min) of the historical centre and main attractions or you can catch the bus 100m or so away. The apartment was new, clean and good quality with 2 double bedrooms each with en-suite bathroom, a well equipped kitchen (which we used on a few evenings - supermarket a few minutes away), Nespresso machine and a comfortable lounge. Continental breakfast available in the main hotel, but we mainly ate in the apartment. Despite being fairly close to a main road and a bar, didn't have any problems with noise as the place has double glazing. Only negatives were that the TV only had satellite channels with little to watch in the evenings (only free ones available) and with the window open you tended to get the smell of tobacco smoke from people gathering outside an Internet cafe below. Staff always keen to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RobertAustralia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night, we found it an easy 15 minute walking distance from the termini train station and also close to a metro stop. The rooms were average compared to others we stayed at during our tour of Italy and due to a early morning tour did not get to try the breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: BruceCPA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the 2nd floor of a building which is on one of the main drags in Rome. It is in a very good location, within walking distance of most sites and very close to the train station. Since our room was on the inside, there was no noise. The room was clean but not very big. The staff was friendly enough. You had to be in the lobby with your computer to get the internet. We stayed here on recommendation from the hotel we had previously booked. Since we changed our itinerary and spend two more days in Rome, we got this hotel as it was only a couple of blocks from the Aberdeen which had bigger rooms and cost less. But the Cortina was fine in a pinch. We did have trouble with the toilet flushing but the staff corrected the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Place to be when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Brisban3Boy
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hotel Cortina The Hotel is very central to all the main site seeing placed in Rome and the train station, apart from having to take a bus to the Vatican City, you just need your walking boots on to get to all other sites. Pros The Breakfast was very good Central Location Excellent service from staff The rooms were very comfortable and clean Cons The only con I can give the Hotel Cortina is the wifi didnt reach our room. When we return in Rome next year we will be staying here again. Chris

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: EKAUS
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cortina is located about 15 mins walk from Termini station. It is close to the metro and the bus stops. 15 min walk to Spanish Steps and about 20 to the Colosseum. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Rooms are small and bathroom is tiny. Breakfast is adequate. Hotel is clean and in a good location. Rome is quite expensive and it cost us 10 euros to get a taxi from Termini - a 3 minute drive! We took the metro and bus around Rome which are much cheaper options. A bus shuttle can be caught from Termini for both airports for 6 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: franb2
Reviews.Content: All the staff were fantastic and extremely helpful, especially with helping me track and get my luggage which was delayed for a few days. The room I stayed in was very comfortable, a good size for a single room, has a mini-bar and was always clean. Breakfast was as expected; there was a variety of items offered and served fresh daily. The breakfast room is small and so conversation with other guests is very easy which was extra nice for me as a solo traveler. The location was perfect for good transportation or walking, lots of restaurants nearby and anything else you might need is easily accessible including a little kiosk nearby that sells metro passes, Roma Pass, calling cards, etc. I stayed here 9 nights and always choose small hotels when I travel to Europe. All the hotels I've stayed in have been great, but this one is by far the best. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a real find - wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SPGEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that we found in Rome from Trip Advisor. We were family with 2 teenage children and the family room sleeping 4 that they had was ideal for us. This hotel has a great location just down from the road from Republicca subway station and the open top bus tours that you can get off and on at any stop so it was really convenient. It is also in walking distance of the Colosseum/Pantheon/Trevi Fountain although we only once walked back as a holiday in Rome involves a lot of walking (and queuing if you don't prebook on the internet which is essential for the Colosseum and Vatican).The hotel doesn't look much from the outside but once you get through the outside door and up the stairs, it is very nice and great value for money. Breakfast is buffet style/help yourself and the room was fine - you don't really want to eat in your hotel in Rome as there are so many great restaurants to try. We particularly liked Gusto and also the Pizzeria da Ricci - the latter is just down the road from the hotel in Via Genova (right at the end in the corner - watch you don't miss it) and sells really good pizzas and also draught Peroni in litre glasses ! Should also mention that the owner of the hotel was extremely helpful and spoke English perfectly - the Colosseum was closed due to flooding on the day that we had tickets but he phoned and sorted it out so that we were able to go back and use our tickets the next day when it had reopened. We had a great time in Rome which is a superb place to go for a long weekend as there is so much to see - and this hotel is the place to stay if you don't want to spend a fortune but want to stay somewhere central.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Maria G
Reviews.Content: Just recently got back from a trip to Europe. Spent a few days in Rome, at the Cortina Hotel. Excellent location, nice staff, and clean rooms. Walking distance to the Fontana Di Trevi, as long as other historical attractions Rome’s historical center. Very pleased with the overall service of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: anjilbabi
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I began and ended our trip to Italy in Rome. We stayed at Cortina both times. I also stayed here two years ago with my daughter. Hotel Cortina is a great value for your stay in Rome. The hotel has 14 rooms, plus 2 gorgeous apartments around the corner from the hotel. Rooms are nicely decorated and very clean. Angleo and his staff are extremely warm, helpful and accommodating. They are great with recommendations and giving you a heads up where not to go. Breakfast is included each morning and they make the best cappuccino. Cortina has a great location. If you don't want to walk, you can easily jump on the Metro or a bus. Hotel Cortina will be our choice on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Full of character & great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Brissie_Girl00
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here for the last 3 nights just gone & can't speak highly enough of Hotel Cortina. It's great value for money noting the central location. The staff were helpful & made us feel very welcome. I found the room & hotel itself to be very clean & our linen seemed to be changed each day. The breakfast is a simple but fresh with mostly pastries & cereals. Even though the hotel is on a busy street our room was one of the quietest I have ever stayed in. We also loved that we could walk easily to all the main sites (although we caught a bus from across the road to the Vatican). Hotel Cortina is not a 5 star hotel, but for the price & location it's certainly a great find. It had a lovely boutique feel & spanned the floor of a lovely old building. I would highly recommend this hotel to all my friends & will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Staff and location are great!”
Reviews.Author: MaryBCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Cortina is a small hotel (14 rooms) in Via Nazionale, 5 minutes walk from Piazza da Republica and the metro station Republica, and close to several bus stops (very central). The hotel is located in one floor of an old Italian building, and street entrance may seem weird, as it is only a tall wood door. But don't get intimidated by the looks downstairs. Reaching the hotel on 1st floor by an old style elevator, the cosy hotel is very nice, well kept and decorated. Rooms are a bit small, but very clean, with good isolated windows, a spacious bathroom, air-con. and free wi-fi. Breakfast is also good (though repetitive) in a cosy little room. But the best of the hotel is its staff. They are all very friendly and helpful, going always the extra mile to assist you in everything (e.g. helping with reservations and good tips, offering free expresso and other coffees when you come back from shopping, etc.). Thanks, Guilly and Angelo for a great stay :-) Definitely recommend! There are also 2 good restaurants nearby the hotel: Target and Del Giglio. Ask at the hotel and they will indicate where to find these restaurants :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: annettemg
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying in this hotel for the four nights I was in Rome. It is not a hotel in the traditional sense, instead it spans the second floor of a very large building. This only made it more enjoyable though as you enter through a lovely big hallway. The gentleman we met on arrival was very friendly and helpful and provided us with a map and instructions on how to get to all the main sights by foot and on the various bus options. He also gave us good advice on where to eat. We decided to explore the city on foot, which was very possible due to the central location of the hotel. We reached the Spanish steps in ten minutes on foot. The Tevi Fountain and The Colloseum were also closeby. The room, although small was spotless and very nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, our 2nd trip back and would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: WendyBNY
Reviews.Content: Angelo is fabulous - arranges drivers for the lowest fees - to and from airport, to Sorrento, other areas as well. He also helped plan our walking tours! Hotel is clean, most comfortable beds, pillows and a/c of our Italy trip. Good breakfasts. Walking distance to many of Rome's attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay, we want to came back!”
Reviews.Author: Gore68
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Cortina Hotel. I loved the walking distance from most major tourist attractions in Rome! The staff was friendly, willing to help at anytime. They even helped me book a tour to Pompeii, which made things a lot more easier for me. The room was comfortable and clean. The “Colazzione” was good. Nice hotel to stay in overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Shawn H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple days before the cruise I went on. I couldn't be more happy with this place. The location was perfect for the rate they charged. You were 5 minutes from the Repubblica metro stop. Via Nazionale was a nice area with all the shops. The staff was amazing, they were all English speaking, and told you the best places to go for dinner, money exchange, and sites. If I ever go back to Rome I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Small Rooms good for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Shaunz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while traveling through Rome further up north. Location: Via Nazionale is a great street with many shops and a couple of bars. Hotel Is one stop away from Roma Termini on the metro. Vatican Is further down the same train line (about 10minutes) or within a leisurely walking distance if you have the time. The colesseum and ancient center is also very close. Staff: fantastic, being such a small hotel (16 rooms?) we delt only eith two gentleman, both were friendly and helpful. Room: We had room 15, overlooking the street. Room was surprisingly quiet and we couldnt hear the noise from the irish pub downstairs. Room was small. And not really any room except to get in and out of the bed, this wasn't a problem for a short stay, but I could imagine would be frustrating on long trips. linen and towels were good however the pillows were like sleeping on a rock. In room minibar was well priced. Pros: Great location Friendly staff Good simple breakfast. Very clean Fast Free wifi in the common areas. Cons: Room a little small. Safe was tiny with a rather unsecure key. Overall: good hotel in via nazionalle with excellent public transport access. Would consider staying here again on future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: LACalgal
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel in a great central location, not fancy but perfect for our needs. We stayed in apartment B in the back of the hotel, you had to enter through a separate side entrance. It was very quiet, and we loved having a little kitchen and living area. The bathroom was very small, but everything was spotless clean. Breakfast was simple, but very good. Angelo, the manager, was so helpful, gave us restaurant referrals, directions, even his umbrella!

Reviews.Title: “Small, Very Friendly, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: landinglight
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel located on the first floor above the Via Nazionale. There is a small lift (elevator). In Rome, hotels are generally not cheap. The Cortina is reasonably priced for its location. It's within 5 minutes walk of Termini (the central bus and train station) and is basically right in the heart of Rome. It's 15 minutes walk from the Colosseum and Trevi Fountain and many other historical sites. There are plenty of good local restaurants within easy walking distance. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Nothing is a problem to them. Breakfast is a pleasant cold buffet. Transport to/from the airport can be arranged at a reasonable rate. They arranged a driver with a mini bus at a very reasonable rate to take the five of us on a day trip outside of Rome, as there were several sites we wanted to visit. This is comfortable small hotel with a big heart in a great location. If you plan to visit the Vatican and/or the Colosseum and Forum, book your tickets online in advance at www.rome-museam.com. Not only are they the official museum site, they are cheaper, under 18s go free, and they are very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Rooms, Average breakfast. Location Wins it!”
Reviews.Author: zedmeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends for one night in July at the end of our Europe trip. Having been to Rome before and our friends not having been to Rome, we wanted to book somewhere reasonably priced as we were only going to be in the room for about 12 hours and we really wanted somewhere that was in a good location so we could give our friends a quick taste of Rome before we headed home. Great Shops and restaurants in the vicinity. This place ticked all the boxes. The location is the best feature of this hotel. It is walking distance to the Colleseum, Trevi, Piazza Navona and and anywhere in between. The hotel is on the first floor of an apartment building but has huge doors with cameras and a buzzer to get you in, so it is both secure and convenient as there is a lift (only one person and cases can fit in it) so it was nice not to have to drag the cases up the stairs. The room was comfortable, small but we didnt need a big room and most hotel rooms in Europe are small so we knew what to expect. Room was well appointed and the bathroom was clean and had everything you would expect. There is 24 hour a day reception and there is usually breakfast included, which is served in a small room adjacent to the small lobby, when I say a small dining room I mean TINY...so you may have to wait for a seat at breakfast. Would recommend this place if you are looking for a a good base and want a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: violinpower
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Apartment B for 8 nights. The apartment is quite, modern, spacious and comfortable. The terrace is beautiful. The Manager and staff are very polite and really care if their guests have a good stay. They were also very, very flexible with the breakfast hours. With a teenage child, we found it hard to make it to the breakfast room before 10:30am. One day after we had breakfast, I apologized to the Manager for being late. He replied, “No problem. We are flexible. We will serve you even if you come right now.” Even though we were late for breakfast, they still came to ask us if we needed coffee or tea everytime. By the way, we didn’t get bored of the choices for the breakfast. There were a lot of varieties of pastry. We had donuts (much better than what we have in the States), croissants (plain or with fillings), danishes, etc. The location is convenient. We walked everywhere, except the Vatican. There are many famous churches in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rhip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Corina for two nights in June. The location is on a very busy street, but the hotel was quiet, no problems sleeping. Like many Italian hotels, it occupies one floor of a larger building, and is a bit spread out. The staff was very accommodating, and took pride in their property and service - and it shows. This is a small property, but the staff is thinking big - like their guests expect first class service and amenities and, within their limitations, they do their best to provide them The location is good, walking distance to Termini, the Forum, and Spanish Steps, etc. A very good value, considering the alternatives. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this, or to return for anther stay.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: roamfamily
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three week trip from Italy, and Hotel Cortina was our first stop. My biggest requirements for a place to stay are cleanliness and location, and Hotel Cortina was perfect. First, I researched many, many hotels in Rome and I found that not many can accomodate a family of four, let alone 2 families of four (we travelled with our friends, who also have two children). The price was less than most others, and the hotel had great reviews, so we booked it. We were so happy with our choice. The staff at the hotel was so kind. Our first day, we overslept way past breakfast, trying to adjust to the time. Our hosts made us cappucino anyways and brought out some pastries for the kids to have a little something too. This gesture was so much appreciated. The room was clean and the bathroom was spotless, with lots of space for our toiletries. They had made a double room into a quad by putting two single beds in side by side. Not much space after that, but we weren't in the room much except to sleep, and it was great for us. The location was excellent. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel, even with four kids in tow. One evening we went to see the Trevi Fountain and then strolled so far we reached the Pantheon. Walked all the way back, too. The train station is about a ten minute walk. We rented our car there and left Rome that way. All was very convenient. Thank you, Hotel Cortina, for your kind welcome to Italy!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy comfort, delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: artyheart
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night as a stop over before our flight home. Wish we had stayed there while in Rome earlier in the week. Well air conditioned, hardwood floors, bathtub and shower, lovely comfy pillows! Pleasant breakfast with good coffee. Staff was so welcoming and made sure every detail was perfect including calling our taxi the morning we left and making sure we were satisfied with our experience. Very reasonably priced E129 for two of us with king sized bed and a twin bed including breakfast. Located on Via Nazionale about two blocks from Piazza Republica, a metro stop and taxi stand. Great restaurant nearby, Target, not cheap but absolutely wonderful food and welcoming staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great services and good located!”
Reviews.Author: Rikalmere
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Rome. We stayed for 4 nights, Mr. Angelo was very helpful and friendly. The room is clean and the buffet breakfast has a big variety and offers great quality food. The hotel is located at the very heart of the centre. Just a few minutes from the metro. The hotel breaths a warm atmosphere and made us feel home. We will surely come back again and will recommend this to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Always my "go-to" hotel when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Winetravelgeek
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cortina was brought to my attention a few years ago by Rick Steves. After trying it once, I now use it as my home base whenever in Rome. It's an elegant, quaint and spotless hotel located on Via Nazionale. Easy to walk to sights, and cabs right outside if needed. I love the fact it is more of a boutique hotel, as you feel special and pampered. Great staff....professional and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good services, value for $$!!”
Reviews.Author: joelletan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 days in June 2011. Pricing: A quad room for 4 of us which comes with bfast cost us €410. It's considered reasonable comparing to other hotel in Rome. But dun expect too much on their bfast, it's a simple one! Location: Located at via nazionale which is within walking distance from termini train station. Right in front of the hotel, there is a bus stop where you can take bus no 60 to go to colosseum, roman forum. Republica train station is within 5 min walk from the hotel which can take you to most of the Rome attractions, ie vatican city, piazza popolo, Spanish steps, trevi fountain & etc. Services: Florian and friends are alwaz there to help or advise. From itineraries to favorite local pizza, you will get the best suggestion from them. Thanks to Florian for the Giggeto pizza at porta pia, it's the best we hv ever had :)

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL! Would Return!”
Reviews.Author: scbean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the recommendation of another hotel in the area that was full. Great location (by the train station), quiet, clean, and wonderful breakfast. The staff was always helpful and gave us good tips. We were very impressed with the owner, Angelo, who knows everything about Rome. He was so helpful. The location is perfect - a nice walk to the Colosseum but close to the Metro. Can't say enough about how lovely the Hotel Cortina is and we will stay there again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT /COMFORTABLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: bc128317
Reviews.Content: During March break one week in Canada ,so we decide go to shopping to Italyl, My husband, son and I stayed for 4 nights at the Hotel Cortina and cannot say enough about how lovely it is. The staff is very warm and helpful , especially Kids walk tried and easily go back to hotel without any trouble, as well as the Manager Angelo and staff always showing warm and striaght from the heart service to every customer . .. The street, Nazionale, is loaded with shops, restraurants , and bars.. bus stop in front of the hotel......good location and price reasonable.. i love this hotel and will come again this summer ...

Reviews.Title: “Nice & cosy”
Reviews.Author: MaureenRiga_Latvia
Reviews.Content: Cosy, hotel in the centre of Rome, not far from all sightseeing attractions, polite staff, fantastic coffee in the morning...However rooms are relatively small (single room) ...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: mookie86
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Rome and Italy itself, my wife and I did tons of research to try to pick the right hotels. Hotel Cortina proved our research was worth it. Not knowing what to expect, Cortina exceeded our expectations. The price was right, the location was perfect, the rooms were cozy and clean, and the staff was excellent. We will be staying here upon our return to Rome. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good located for a city trip for a cheap price”
Reviews.Author: Sentosa69
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife and son end of Feb early March for some days and had a real good deal for a double room incl breakfast. 4 nigths just 274 Euros for all of us. In the end I paid 366 Euros as they have given us a three bed room. I did not insist on my reservation as it was more convenient two have a 3rd bed for our 9 year old one. The Cortina is located on Via Nazionale close to Termini hence ideally located for sightseeing and we did it all by walking around. The hotel itself is located on the 1st floor in an old building complex and hard to find if you go there the first time. The staff is extraordinary friendly and helpful. Breakfast really good for three Stars, but after 4 days you are saturated as it is always the same. Big disadvantage is that directly beneath is an Irish pub. We arrived late or better early Saturday morning and till 2 am you heard the noise of the pub music , bam, bam, bam. The same on Saturday night, however sunday and monday was quiet. In order to compensate for the silence the guys from waste collection bumped around the garbage tons at 4 am, but thats usual in Italy. Overall It would recommend that Hotel as the location is good breakfast ok for some days and price is good as well. Disadavantage as mentioned the noise on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Do not hesitate to stay”
Reviews.Author: oldsailor62
Reviews.Content: Simple, friendly, good located. Room have a good noise insulation (except narrow passage way noises, but fortunately the guests were careful about this)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cortina Roma is the place to stay when in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TidwellTravel
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! I have stayed in other hotels in my many trips to Rome, but since discovering this hotel several years ago, I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. The location is perfect, a 10 minute walk from Termini and steps away from buses and metro. It's central location also makes it convenient to walk to many famous sites. The staff is helpful and friendly. The rooms are spotless and the breakfasts are wonderful. We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Cortina Roma and I look forward to returning again and again.

Reviews.Title: “All basics you need in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SamTang
Reviews.Content: It's a basic, clean hotel in good location....that all my need!! I went to hotel @ 8.00 am. The manager(Angrlo Milana) told me that my room would be ready in an hour ( check in time = 13.00pm) and offered me the compliment breakfast. That was very nice after I was on airplane 12 hours. He also allowed me to use his computer to print my ticket online to Vatican Musuem for free. I really appreciated it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JimUK73
Reviews.Content: Like a sort of "townhouse" style hotel in the centre Rome. Great location near train stations and main visitor sites. Very helpful staff. Clean, comfortable rooms - but quite small. No restaurant but many nearby. Overall - excellent quality and value. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Personal Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tereiling
Reviews.Content: Central location puts Rome at your fingertips, as well as footsteps. Small size (14 rooms) ensures personal service, more like one finds in 4-star hotels. I stepped right off its very busy street into an oasis of tranquility. Employees aim to please - very friendly, full of helpful information, tips and spot on recommendations. Generous use of the Internet for research, confirmations, even printing out tickets & boarding passes. I appreciated the restaurant recommendations in an area nearby frequented by the locals, not tourists. Rooms are comfortable and well kept. My new go to spot in Rome. Truly a hidden treasure!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: armsparkdan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Cortina with my girlfriend for 4 nights in February 2011, based on the glowing reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. This is a lovely little hotel situated in a characterful building in a great location in the middle of Rome, within easy walking distance of the main train station and most sightseeing attractions. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, always ready to offer help and advice in their perfect English. The room we had, while not huge, was comfortably big enough for two, was very nicely decorated and had a pleasant view on to the church across the road. The continental buffet breakfast, served until 10.30am (useful for us lazy people), was perfectly adequate without being massively inspiring. All in all, I thought our stay was great value for the relatively small amount we paid. The only minor gripe I had was that there was some traffic noise during the night - but this is to be expected for a central location, and it's only a small problem that can be easily solved through buying some earplugs. If you're on a budget and want a clean, comfortable and friendly place to stay in the middle of Rome, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated city center perfect dining just steps away!”
Reviews.Author: Swenksj
Reviews.Content: Friends and I had visit to Rome and we were staying at the Hotel Cortina Roma, just a perfect location close to shopping/dining area and most of the historical part of Rome. Hotel is fully furnished, services, full breakfast. served. We had a great stay and thanks again to the staff for the hospitality. Swen

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MYLeeHeidi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cortina's very good location, well equipment, impeccable cleaness, great hospitality of Mr. Angelo and the staff of the hotel, their good recommendation for the restaurants, very useful travel advice..all made our stay in Rome a really really perfect one. My husband and I have decided that next time when we go back to Rome, Hotel Cortina is our only choice.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Rome for a week with two teenagers”
Reviews.Author: Europe201011
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 week European adventure and the last week of our stay was at the Hotel Cortina Rome. We would recommend that families book the Apartment "A" which is a comfortable modern apartment suitable for 2 adults and 2 teenage children. The staff were friendly and most helpful, the hotel is well located and includes free wifi accesss, or the internet is available right next door to the apartment. The cost was excellent value and included a continetal breakfast which was fine. The hotel is well located to the major sights and shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Diomed
Reviews.Content: We would just like to add our comment in praise of this lovely hotel and its staff. We stayed there last winter, in apartment B, for five days and even though the weather wasn't so good, our excellent accommodation and friendly, helpful, good English-speaking hosts Angelo, Florian and Valentino (who spared us trouble and time with some good tips and advice) made our first visit to Rome worthwhile. Breakfast included somewhat limited choice of pastry, but it was all fresh and tasty and the espresso they served was really good too. The apartment had been completely refurbished, very comfortable for a couple, offering practically everything you might need during your stay, from cutlery and dishware to first-aid kit. It was fully equipped with household appliances, making you feel at home, in your own kitchen, and most importantly, it was immaculately clean. To sum it up, this hotel is highly recommended and we would definitely go back there any time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: olympiad
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed for 2 nights at the Hotel Cortina and cannot say enough about how lovely it is. The staff is very warm and welcoming and the location is perfect. We walked easily to the Colliseum without any trouble as well as the Roman Forum. The street, Nazionale, is loaded with shops, restraurants , and bars so if you need to grab something close by it's easy. the metro station (Republic) is only about 2-3 blocks and can easily be reached within 10 minute walk. There is a lovely breakfast served every morning that includes pastries, cold cereals, meats and cheeses along with juices, coffee and tea. I love cappucinos and the darling waitress made me 3 each morning! She is just precious and adds to the overall experience with her smiling disposition. The windows in the room opened up to a lovely side street next to an old church. Being the kind that loves fresh air I kept ours open as much as possible! All in all this hotel is a wonderful place to call home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Rome perfect Rome”
Reviews.Author: fabtripinuk
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to Angelo, Florian and Valentino - three perfect hosts and perfect gentlement. Accommodation was great. Close to transport (bus and train). Heaps of restaurants. Good breakfast. Extremel hospitable - prfessional and friendly. Could not have asked for more. Finally - great price.

Reviews.Title: “If going to Rome you must stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Seattle-wa-jim
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two weeks in, Rome and Amalfi coast. Our stay in Rome was significantly enhanced by the staff and Mr. Angelo Milana of the Hotel Cortina on Via Nazionale, just a few blocks from the main train station Roma Termini. Our apartment was spacious, very well appointed with a great bath and small kitchen. The terrace off the bedroom was great. If you go to Rome stay at this hotel. Hotel Cortina Roma [hotelcortinaroma@tiscali.it] Mr. Angelo Milana and the staff received us graciously and provided invaluable local information and advice. Prior to leaving the USA Mr. Milana was tremendously helpful in obtaining train tickets, museum reservations and travel advise. The Hotel Cortina’s location takes advantage of the metro within two blocks and the main train station for day trips just four blocks away. The hotel is completely ringed by great restaurants and pizzerias.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in middle of city of Rome”
Reviews.Author: katrienduck
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Cortina for 5 days and we were very glad we booked a room at this hotel. There are a lot of hotels in Rome, and we wanted a good, nice and clean hotel on a good location. We've found it all in hotel Cortina. Very nice room, very good location and very clean. We have stayed in several hotels all over the world, but this was a very good hotel. Breakfast was also perfect, as well as the people there. They were very friendly and always willing to help you during your trip in rome. I don't have any negative points, except that I should suggest that the hotel should offer free wifi in the room, if they do that, they would be absolutely perfect and one of the top hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Just about OK - but avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: Grin X
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was very, very good, but the breakfast and the service were poor. First of all, the pictures that are shown on the website are not how the hotel rooms look. They are much smaller. Secondly, the security is poor. Anyone can ring the bell at the gate on the main road, and the door will open. They barely ever check. Next, the staff was rude. There was only one computer terminal between the reception and for the guest Internet usage, and the guy on the reception kept yelling when I wanted to use it at night. Moreover, he looked and sounded drunk, in which he was yelling. We stayed there only for one night fortunately. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment!!!”
Reviews.Author: pnkangel
Reviews.Content: Loved the Apartment B for Hotel Cortina. It was just around the corner from the actual hotel, more than enough space for me and my husband. It had a nice patio, walkable to most attractions and a good Irish Pub nearby. Mr. Angelo was very helpful and cleaning staff was great! If we had a chance to come back again, we would definitely stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel with great comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: calixta_203
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful stay at Hotel Cortina. The hotel’s rooms were clean, nice, and very comfortable. Mr. Angelo offered us to continue our stay moving to an apartment just around the corner, It was wonderful, perfectly furnished, safe, adding privacy and convenience while maintaining hotel’ services. We received proof of honesty and support from all staff members. Mr. Florian took care of us and gave us a lot of support. Traveling through Italy with my two young grandchildren was a big challenge. Our stay at Hotel Cortina greatly contributed to arrive at the end with a great success. We are looking forward to stay again at Hotel Cortina on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Made our weekend break - so good we've already booked to go back”
Reviews.Author: BMAC64
Reviews.Content: Great location, very friendly and helpful staff, a gem of a find...what trip advisor is all about! We have already booked to go back later in the year we enjoyed ourselves so much. We didn't take the offered airport transfer (costs double what train would for two people), but would be worth doing so if there are at least two of you travelling or if you have luggage. The hotel is above an Irish pub and just across from the reformed church - the sign for it is on a pole in the street rather than on the wall. So it took us a minute or two to find it first time as it was dark. Slept really well...the bed was just soooooo...comfortable. Highly recommended and with a great italien restaurant just across the road (Barocca - probably not spelt right...with house red at €8 a bottle.....), just perfect for a city break to Rome with many of the key sites in easy walking distance. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, great value, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: fifivixen
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and it met all of the reviews stated. The hotel was a charming little hotel in a great location. Close to the train station and yet far away enough from the seediness of the train station, close to the metro, within walking distance of the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Pantheon and many other sights. The staff at the hotel are lovely and very helpful. The rooms aren't large but big enough. We were allocated #10 but due to a mix-up given #4. #10 is larger but noisier. #4 faces nothing really but is much quieter and we slept very comfortably here. This is the reason I gave sleep quality only a three. The breakfasts are certainly more than adequate if you are an omnivore or vegetarian. As a vegan, they made a special effort for me which I appreciated. However, if I stay there again, I will go to Despar which is the supermarket two minutes down the road from the hotel and buy whatever I want for brekkie. There is a charming little breakfast room. Angelo, killy, Florian are all lovely and very helpful. Definitely a little find.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded - and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TheCrossEyedNewt
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at Hotel Cortina after reading Tripadvisor; just for one night and a 3-bed room for my family (two small kids, me and my wife). Paid 180 euro, which should be average for Rome, hotel standard and location. Arrived in the afternoon after a long drive from Tuscany - and the very nice manager offered us the ordered 3-bed room in a hour as it was being cleaned OR getting the hotel's apartement 150 meters away. He promised us that we would not be disappointed (probably as my wife and I looked a bit suspiscious), ordered a taxi for us and the luggage and walked himself over to the apartment on Via Modena to greet us. And instead of a 3-bedroom, we got a huge apartment: two bedrooms, two bathrooms, living room, dining room, fully equipped kitchen, balcony.... situated on a quiet side street to Via Nazionale. Breakfast was at the hotel, nothing to shout about but my only recommendation is that IF you are offered the apartement on Via Modena instead of a hotel room is to take it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family with children”
Reviews.Author: mutrax
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights at the begining of our trip to Italy and then again 2 nights at the end. We got the apartment "2" : very roomy and full equiped. No internet, but there's an Internet "café" next door. It's location is ideal : near the Termini station, Reppublica metro station, 15 min walking to the Coliseum, etc. The only attraction we had to take the metro was the Vatican. The staff is very helpful and they'll give you directions and recommend nearby restaurants. The elevators are minuscule, but that's a minor inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: mereider
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nites at the Modena Apartment, 2 mums and their daughters... Was plenty room and in a great area to either walk or catch buses. Florian and Claudio were very helpful and referred us to a Trattoria that we all enjoyed. Spacious, comfortable, good area, good managers.. No wifi but is a internet shop next door. The photos on their web site are correct. Highly recommend. thanks Hotel Cortina..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cortina Apartments are a great value - perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: alisonh13
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the two Hotel Cortina apartments. The apartments are in a building around the corner from the hotel. They are nicely furnished and clean (the pictures on the website are accurate). Hotels in Rome can be quite expensive so staying in the apartments was a great way to save money. Breakfast at the hotel is also included, which was a nice bonus. The location is very convenient to the train station and to the Republica metro stop. The walk to the historic area (Pantheon, etc.) is a little far, but not unmanageable. We found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is a little hard to find (sign is small and door is nondescript), but just keep an eye out for the sign and look for an Irish pub next door.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: john7267
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a wonderful 4 nite stay at Hotel Cortina. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the location can't be beat! The room was clean, freshly decorated and fit our needs perfectly. It has a screen flat panel TV, very comfortable bed, large and newly furnished bath. I worked in customer service for a large airline for many years, I know the secret to repeat business among other things is good customer service and they have figured that out! Overall, convenient to public transit; convenient to shopping and dining; wonderful staff; comfortable spacious rooms and superb amenities; give this one a try!!! If and when I return to Rome I shall look no further.

Reviews.Title: “A great little find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller056
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel, centrally located near the Termini Railway Station. The owners are very helpful and the hotel lived up to all our expectations and the reviews which convinced us to stay there. If we ever go back to Rome then we will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Arrival to Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirkyitis
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel to anyone arriving for their first time in Rome. Easy to find, good location (can walk from Termini), Metro close too, food/other shopping nearby, friendly staff, and pleasant breakfast in the a.m. Great orientation hotel. We were 2 women travelling and the area never felt unsafe. We had a room with 2 single beds with window/s that opened onto Via Nazionale. When they were closed it was quiet. Average space and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: sarah75_10
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Cortina and enjoyed our stay immensely. As for the rooms, ours was spacious and comfortable, spotlessly clean and very functional, with a large and nice bathroom, A/C, safe. They also booked Airport Transfer for us and it was a great service a really top quality transfer. Overall, a great hotel, great location, close to all monuments and to train station, friendly helpful staff. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Allinnn
Reviews.Content: I researched lots of hotels throughout Italy over a period of several days/weeks to plan my 2nd honeymoon and I'm so glad I choose this hotel. As a first time traveler to Italy (or Europe for that matter) I didn't know what to expect. Many friends warned me to lower my expectations of what I am used to in America (specifically California) but I didn't want to do that. So I researched until I found a place that seemed comparable without breaking our budget. Here are my pros and cons: PROS: CAR SERVICE pick up from the airport: very friendly/helpful driver who drove us to the bank to get Euros before anything else. He gave us a brief "tour" of the sites we passed STAFF: Very friendly and always seemed more than willing to help us make our stay more pleasurable. They gave us a map and told us how long to expect each walk to take and recommended good places to eat. We were also able to use and "internet key" to send emails to our young kids so they wouldn't miss us too badly. LOCATION: AWESOME. We walked EVERYWHERE and took short cab rides back at night (only bc I was too tired from walking since I woke up). There is a Metro station a couple of blocks down that we used to get to Vatican City. There is a grocery store a couple of blocks down as well and several locally owned shops lined the street for those who simply must shop while on vacation BREAKFAST: AWESOME, the breakfast room is quaintly decorated with linen table cloths and serves fresh pastries, rolls, juices, cheese, meats, yogurts, etc. I had (2 or 3) freshly made cappuccino every morning by a nice woman w/a very warm smile. BED: Was firm just the way we like it and we slept very well each night. CONS: KEY: You have to turn in your room key before you leave and get it back when you return. I'm just not used to this but everything seemed to be in place when we returned, I even left my laptop in the room and it was untouched. ROOM: I'm not going to lie, it was a little bit small but we weren't tripping over each other. It served it's purpose (to hold our luggage and give us a place to crash at night) and was quaintly decorated. BATHROOM: The water temp did fluctuate while showering but only for brief seconds so it wasn't that big of a deal to me at all. The hair dryer was quite old and seemed to over heat while drying my very long and thick hair but it wasn't that big of a deal to me. Overall we very much enjoyed this hotel and would love to come back some day with our 2 kids and rent one of their apartments. Thank you to all of the staff that made our 2nd honeymoon soooo memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Must have at wrong Hotel Cortina, Rome !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Glenda-266
Reviews.Content: Well... what can I say !!! We stayed at this Hotel last night based on the rating by Others on Trip Advisor. We originally booked 2 nights but decided to leave after the first night. We were put in Room 11 so the comments here pertain to that room. In short, you would need a pygamy cat to be able to swing it in this room. I've included photos as proof. Two people could not walk around the room. I spent the stay climbing over the bed to get out the door. There was a window that faced onto an internal alcove that was used by the housekeeping staff. There was, as a result, no natural light so we had to leave the light on to see where we were going to trip over. There were no spare power points to charge phones, etc. When I switched off the main light the switch cover fell off the wall. Now the bathroom, or more appropriate, the bathroom closet ! The ancient hairdryer cord fell out of the handle as soon as i touched it. The shower tiles had mould ingrained. There was no soap holder in the shower (probably because you couldnt fit one in it). The water pressure was non existent and just warm enough not to to be cold. Considering the positive comments, all we can say in that if you are given the key to room 11 .. run for your life !!!! We had just spent 5 weeks in Europe and stayed at fantastic three/four star hotels that we could not fault. We stayed a week at Sorrento in Hotel Minerva and had a huge room that over looked the Bay of Naples - at the same daily rate we paid for the hotel Cortina. The comparison would be 4 stars versus 1 star. In all our years travelling we have only once stayed in a worse room and that was in the Berry Pub in Australia - and we just laughed at that one..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the money and location”
Reviews.Author: JR2010_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very secure. The room was reasonably sized compared with our other stays in Europe. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and attended to our every need. Cappiccino, yogurt, pastries and juices were our daily complimentary breakfast (cheeses, meats, rolls and fruit were also available). The breakfast room was small but adequate (we had to wait for a table for 5 minutes one day). The hotel provides information and recommends restaurants on a daily board. The restaurants that we tried were all good. There is an internet cafe around the corner and many of the main historical sights are just a few minute walk away. We opted to have the hotel provide us with round trip transport from the airport. The cost was $55.00 to the hotel and $50.00 back to the airport. This was ore expensive than a cab but it felt great to get our bags, walk through customs and have someone waiting for us. The only downside was the Irish Pub next door had a DJ one night. It sounded like he (and the crowd) were in our room. This went on for 2 1/2 hours. We mentioned it to the manager the next morning and they were very apologetic. It did not happen again during our 7 night stay. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Apartment in Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TD200956
Reviews.Content: We stayed in both the Apartment A on arrival in Rome, and in the hotel itself for a single night on our way back out of Italy. The Apartment is nothing short of perfect for a family group. We travel as two adults and two kids aged 10 and 5, so getting reasonably priced accommodation that suits us is very hard, but the Apartment was fantastic. It has such a spacious and homey feel about, but is still very modern and stylish in its interior. The apartment is immaculately maintained, and looks like it is almost brand new. There was loads of space for us and the kids, and the manager both organised very economical transport from the airport (after a 6am arrival) and met us at the apartment. Breakfast is served at the hotel, which is about 25m around the corner (and very convenient, despite what other reviewers might have written). Best of all, the location is in the heart of the best part of Rome, with a number of lovely restaurants nearby, and the major train station for Rome only a 10 minute stroll up the road. We caught the train to Naples, and it was an easy walk even with luggage and children in tow. The main stop for the open top bus services is only a 5 minute walk away, and was our main means of transport for all our Roman sightseeing. There is also a supermarket 50m down the road, which allowed us to do a bit of self catering to suit the specific tastes of our kids, as well as stock up on local Chianti! We had a family (quadruple) room for one night on the way out, which had a queen and two single bed, which was adequate for us. After having stayed in the apartment the quad room was a little cramped, but it was certainly well maintained, clean and suitable. Both mangers were perfect gentlemen, who greeted us with a smile every time we saw them, and made us feel very much at ease and comfortable. All in all the Hotel Cortina, and especially the Apartment A, made our stay in Rome nothing short of perfect, and was a wonderful way to begin our Italian adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Sightseeing in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pennyork
Reviews.Content: There are four of us so we took the option to stay in an apartment a short walk from the hotel & to breakfast at the hotel. The apartment was spacious and very comfortable. Florian greeted us at the apartment block after arranging transport from the airport. He took time to advise us on sightseeing & restaurants. The service when we went to the hotel for breakfast was also first class. All the sights we visited were within walking distance of the hotel although we did use the nearby metro one way for a couple of visits.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff, comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nonamevirginia
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel is absolutely wonderful. They are friendly, the location is great, quaint breakfast room. Comfortable beds, we had a room on the street which proved a little noisy at night but we also had the window and shutters open. this is a comfortable and nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: LZMZ
Reviews.Content: Short walk from Termini, out the main door a little to the left and up to Republica and make a left on Via National , 5 - 10 mins walk. There is also a Metro stop at Republica and a bus stop almost right in front of the hotel. The staff was very helpful. The only negative was the tendency of the water temperature to fluctuate during a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cortina - A great find”
Reviews.Author: BigAlUK43
Reviews.Content: We had booked a 3 bedded room - Grandparents and 12 year old boy, but Angelo emailed us to offer an apartment for just a little extra, and the photos sold it to us. We were not disappointed. Modern. very well appointed apartment and as the weather was not great while we were there it was ideal for us to come back and have a hot drink etc. Could have cooked a meal if we had wished. Probably 50% more space than we would get in a hotel room. The entrance to the hotel reception is on the first floor of the building (seems a lot are like that in Rome), and the entrance to our apartment was down a side street into the same building. Walking distance of the station, supermarkets and all levels of restaurants, yet no noise to disturb us. I have no hesitation in recommending the Apartment

Reviews.Title: “Warm and inviting and great value hotel in the heart of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: PennsylvaniaKat
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room at Hotel Corina as it was recommended by several people on Rick Steves' helpline. It was clean and quiet. We could walk to the hotel from the rail station and we were welcomed warmly. The concierge was wonderful and spoke excellent English. When we arrived, we were shown to our room which was small but all that we needed as we only slept there. The concierge gave us a map of the city and helped us get our bearings before we headed out. On our second night there, we asked for a recommendation for a "local" restaurant and enjoyed a delicious meal in a small intimate restaurant. We were given a discount because we mentioned the hotel. The concierge ordered a car to take us to the airport as this was our last day in Italy and the car arrived on time and the driver couldn't have been friendlier. We will return to this hotel next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and friendly Staff service”
Reviews.Author: WodongaWanders
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved this hotel! Hotel Cortina is located within one kilometre of the main station "Roma Termini" and close to the "Hop On Hop Off" bus terminal. It is well located for easy access to all of Rome's major tourist sights with the added bonus of having excellent Staff who provide cheerful, friendly and helpful service, daily supplying my wife and I with information, maps and advice on Rome's attractions. The en-suited room was spacious, clean with a very comfortable bed and had airconditioning that worked well, particularly in the unseasonably warm weather that we experienced in November 2009 in Rome. The cold breakfast provided was excellent and I particularly noticed that the staff were very attentive with respect to ensuring that sufficient food and liquid refreshments were available to all their clients at that time. The only proviso I have regarding Hotel Cortina is that as it is not a "Street front" location, visitors need to be aware to keep a sharp eye out for the Hotels business sign (just past the Irish Pub) on Via Nazionale. Since returning to Australia we have spent our time telling our friends about our fabulous experience at Hotel Cortina and apart from booking a room at the Papal Residence we cannot think of a better hotel at which to stay in Rome - thoroughly reccommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, the apartments for rent are recommended”
Reviews.Author: TravelVav
Reviews.Content: We started our stay at the hotel itself , which was located perfectly in Rome. The rooms were quite small and not very modern , for example, the phone in our room wasnt working and the bed spread was quite outdated and worn out, however, overall, the room was clean and sufficient. We were moved to the apartments the hotel offers (they couldnt offer a 3 night stay as the hotel was booked thus the apartment was offered to us and we accepted) and I would highly recommend the apartment which was modern, plush, and gorgeous. If I were to return to Rome, I would def. rent out the apartment again. The staff are very friendly, helpful and caring and the breakfast was simple but nice. Dont expect a 'modern' hotel , its really in my opinion about the location and a clean place to get a good nights rest in. Nothing more.. nothing less. The apartment is more luxurious but I would advise to book it more in advance as it's probably more popular.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant apartments seperate to the hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: shirl024
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel/apartment last minute as we required an apartment for 2 nights that would accept a dog. The location is great, the main hotel is on Via Nationziale, but the apartment is a few doors away on the side street Via Napoli. Its an ideal location for exploring Rome wiht the great transport links Rome has this apartment has bus stops and the Metro outside the hotel. The apartment was amazing we were very please. Large two bedroom apartment on the 4th floor with a lift, both roome ensuite, a large fully equipped dining kitchen and large living/dining room with flatscreen tv. The apartment is also equipped with a safe. Very clean and comfortable We would deffinately recommend it and deffinatley return. There is secure garage parkig in the street opposite. Breakfast was included in the price, located in the main hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sssshhhhhhh This is a gem”
Reviews.Author: Annie72
Reviews.Content: Sssshhh this hotel is an incredible gem. We have been going every year, at least once a year for 10 years. You can't get better.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful holiday in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate2272
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel situated in the midlle of Rome, very near to the most attractions like: Colosseum, Spagna square, Romans Forum... The staff it was extremely courteous and approachable!... the Manager Angelo gave some great recommendations with regard to restaurants, money changing services, and shops in the area. The room it was perfect and clean and the breakfast delicious for every flavours. I would stay again here for the comforts and for the lovely Hotel ! ONE OF THE BEST TRIPS! FOR FOOD, ATTRACTIONS, SHOPS, AND HOETL! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Hotel Cortina!”
Reviews.Author: Arizona1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent New Year's Eve at Hotel Cortina's Apartment "B" around the corner from the Hotel on Via Napoli. We loved everything about it! From the moment we arrived Angelo took great care of us. The apartment was awesome and we were within walking distance to everything! There was a free breakfast in the hotel that was great! I can not wait to go back to Rome and when we do, we will most certainly stay at the Hotel Cortina. There is also an internet cafe right next door so you can keep in touch with home. This neighborhood is very safe and the apartment has an in-room safe to keep your valuables. We really enjoyed this hotel. My only complaint is with the Irish Pub next door, they were always either out of food or not serving whenever my husband and I stopped in.
