Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff, clean and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Chipgal1
Reviews.Content: Stayed two separate times in January at the Holel Cortina and absolutely loved this hotel. Centrally located, only a few blocks to Termini railroad station (11 euros from the airport) on a grand boulevard. Warmly received by staff and owner Angelo. Clean and attractive small room. Perfect for seeing the sights of Roma. First day I walked to the Colosseum -- maybe 20 mintues. Good value and reccomendations for restaurants. Can't wait to come back during warmer weather...hopefully this year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice big modern apartment!”
Reviews.Author: YKim
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently returned from a 16day trip covering Venice, Rome and Paris. While searching for suitable accommodation for my family of 2 adults and 2 teen girls, I came across the Hotel Cortina website. We specifically wanted 2bathrooms and 2 bedrooms and I found the perfect solution in the apartments owned and managed by the Hotel Cortina. Basically, the apartments are situated a few doors away down a side lane from the main hotel so its quiet at night if you keep the windows closed. There are 3 apartments in that building managed by the hotel. Apartment A which we had that sleeps 4. Apartment B that can sleep up to 3 with one person utilising the sofa bed and another bigger apartment that can sleep up to 5. All the apartments are done up in a modern style and unlike the smaller hotel rooms, the apartment has lots of space. The apartment complex also has a small lift so you don't need to climb the stairs, especially with luggage when you check in or check out. You enter the apartment to see a big living and dining area. There is a big flat screen tv and DVD player. Then you walk through to see a full sized kitchen fully equipped with a full sized stove, refrigerator and the necessary condiments like oil, salt,pepper and even other spices to make a quick meal. There is a smaller table and 4chairs in the kitchen as well. Situated on either end of the kitchen are the two bedrooms. The master bedroom with its own ensuite has a bathtub, sink and toilet plus a bidet. The master bedroom has a king size bed and a full sized wardrobe. The other bedroom has two twin beds and and also its own ensuite with a sink, bidet, toilet and a shower. There is a small safe in the closet just outside the twin bedroom. The apartment is centrally heated throughout and a plus which we found is that both bedrooms and the living room has its own airconditioning unit which we found useful when we experienced 2 warmer afternoons while in Rome. Emailed the hotel directly to book and Angelo was very nice. He gave me a small discount off the rates which was very reasonable for such a big apartment. Our rates also include buffet breakfasts which we had at the hotel building. Unlimited amount of coffee/tea/hot chocalate, pastries, cold cuts and yoghurt and fruits which kept us full till our late lunch at 3pm on two days when we had tours in the mornings. We found the location on Via Nationale near Termini Station convenient for transportation and food. A few grocery shops and supermarkets within walking distance and this area near the train station is quite safe. We had no problems walking around the area at night. There are several consulates situated along this street and we found policemen on petrol everywhere. I find that Rome is quite safe generally. Just take the necessary precautions, don't wear flashy jewellery and don't carry large amount of money about. We enjoyed our trip very much. Would highly recommend this hotel and apartments run by Angelo and his very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cortina my favorite”
Reviews.Author: Lambbeth
Reviews.Content: After staying in numerous hotels in Italy during my recent three week vacation, Hotel Cortina was my favorite. The room was spotless, the staff most helpful and friendly and the breakfast was above average. The hotel provided a safe haven in a most convenient location. I will recommend Hotel Cortina to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: monmat
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and very helpful with suggestions for restaurants and for help in navigating the city. The breakfast was excellent -- good variety with coffee made to order. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked well. The bedroom and bathroom were very clean. The location is good for ease of walking and for close access to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto !”
Reviews.Author: Ciao_Bella12
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived at Cortina Hotel on August 10 2009. It was our second time coming back to Cortina. This time around, we got to spend the night in Apartment A and it was just wonderful. It was very clean and spacious especially when you have a 10 year old and a 16 year old. The Manager Angelo was very welcoming and helpful. He showed us the way of getting around Rome by public transit and was always able to fulfill our needs. The hotel location is very convient because its location is very central. It is 10 minutes away from the Termini train station. Breakfast was always fresh with a wide selection. I would definitely recommend this place to anybody who is looking for a great accommodating hotel in Rome. My family and I will definitely be going back next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST TRIP TO EUROPE”
Reviews.Author: Aus-traveller09
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early, but were able to leave our luggage and go walking, the room was ready at 11am. Tyical of European rooms, clean and small, but did have bar fridge which was useful for drinks when the temperature was over 40c every day. Bathroom had tub, but very poor water pressure. Breakfast was sufficient and coffee good. Staff were excellent on advising transport, attractions etc etc. Location is superb for train travellers or catching bus. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect”
Reviews.Author: TrulliMadrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in Hotel Cortina. The location of the hotel is perfect. It's quite central and furthermore it's a ten minute walk to the train station. The next metro station (red line) is located at Republica, which is about 300 m away. Our room was very spacious and comfortable. At the beginning of August it was quite hot outside. As a matter of fact, we were happy to have A/C which worked very silently. The staff was very friendly and helpful. To sum it up: A great hotel at a good location with a very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for site seers”
Reviews.Author: Tahoe09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location for our 4 night stay. It is right on a major drag, near the train station. We walked to all the sights, including Vatican City and Villa Borghese, but could easily take the train or bus to most sites, too. The staff is very professional, thoughtful and helpful. The breakfast is good (best coffee we had at a hotel while in Italy). Our room was much smaller than expected, but very clean and quiet with tasteful furnishings. If you are in Rome to see the sites (not to use fancy hotel amenities) and just want a safe, quiet place to stay where you will be well-taken care of, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: bordeauxvin
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel, very clean and central located. The staff is very professional and attentive. We have stayed at the apartment "b" located in Via Napoli and for us was a luxury experience. We wish to go back to beautifull Rome and wish to use their service again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Erino2
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect place to stay in Rome. It is near to most transportation. Just make sure you have an address and phone number in case the taxi can't find it. I would even have directions...just in case. I will stay here again if I am ever in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great find for nice rooms and good location without outrageous prices”
Reviews.Author: KinWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cortina was exactly what I had hoped to find. Everything I wanted without paying four star prices. When you arrive, there's an elevator to get you to the first floor hotel. (In Europe the first floor is the floor above the lobby.) Don't take this for granted. In Rome, many of the hotels are on upper floors of larger buildings and they don't always have elevators. The room was bigger than others I have stayed in in Europe, but note that doesn't mean it was as big as a standard American hotel room. There were heavy blackout shades that enabled us to sleep whenever we wanted to, which is a bonus when you are working through your jet lag. The bed was comfortable and there were extra pillows and blankets. The room had its own individually controlled air conditioner for no extra charge (again, don't assume this will always be the case in Rome hotels). The bathroom was reasonably large and attractive, with a stand-up shower (no tub) and a hair dryer. The front desk staff was nice and helpful with directions and information. They even served us breakfast our first day at noon, even though breakfast hours ended at 10:00. The only quirky things about the place were occassional bursts of cold water in the shower and that the hair dryer would get very hot when you used it for long. Not big complaints in my book. The location of Hotel Cortina is great. We walked there from Termini train station and had no problem finding it. But it is a bit of a long walk. You can also take the Metro one stop from Termini to the Republica station and then you are only about three blocks from the hotel. Being three blocks from the Metro is handy in general. That Metro is the line (Line A) that takes you to the Vatican/St. Peters and the Spanish Steps. We walked just about everywhere except the Vatican. It's about 10-15 minutes walk to the Colluseum/Forum area, and about 15 minutes walk to Trevi Founctain or the Spanish Steps. Also, there is an Internet cafe around the corner from the hotel and a grocery store about a block and a half away. Note that there is no Internet in the hotel. I asked for a quiet room and we were facing the courtyard out back. No view, but nice and quiet. We were in Rome the night before the European Cup championship (soccer/football) and the Irish pub downstairs was crazy. We had fun going down to watch the signing and shouting, but couldn't hear it at all up in our room. I'm not sure if that was the case in other rooms that night. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Flyingphilt
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the large, imposing wooden door entrance from the busy street that you have to buzz to enter... the hotel, located on the first floor of the large building (it's even an adventure to use the old lift with manual closing doors!!), is excellent value. The rooms and public areas were very clean and the staff friendly. The breakfast was a delight, as much as you could eat from a cold buffet and served in a lovely decorated room. Great location near the Termini (but not too close to the seedy hotel 'ghetto' that surrounds the station itself). Short walk to all the main attractions of Rome (albeit a short bus ride to the Vatican). Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “classic apartment convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelsoon
Reviews.Content: 3 Bedroom apartment is managed by the Hotel Cortina in an older by well run building. Angelo was a perfect host meeting us to check in and make sure we knew where we were going. 24 hour desk at hotel around the corner is great for getting help. They booked car for us to airport. To get to apartment from train station takes you through seedier part of Rome. However, once you are there you are convenient to walk to historic Roman areas (15 minute walk), bus to St. Pieters (15 minutes #40), and most piazzas and spanish steps (15 minute walk). Good restaurant options and grocery nearby. A quaint two person elevator is available to take you up to 2nd floor unit. Kitchen was well equipped and washer was appreciated. No view to speak of, but this is Rome, you don't really stay in that much. Very clean and modern bathrooms. Master Bedroom very sizable. a real bargain compared to the closets that are most hotel rooms in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Nice Location, Loved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: bobcolumbus
Reviews.Content: Were offered a stay in an apartment managed by the hotel. The apartment is about 100 feet from the hotel. Newly renovated, clean, stylish, and comfortable are the words to describe the wonderful one-bedroom apartment (the apartment was called the "Milano"). The apartment had an efficiency kitchen that includes a two-burner smooth-top range, a small fridge, microwave, and all plates, glassware and utensils. The apartment was on the second floor, serviced by an elevator (lift). The rate for the apartment was a great value with a flat weekly rate. The hotel offers linen service every third day in the apartments. We saved money by having a couple of meals in our apartment with food we bought at the grocery store about one minute walk away. The apartment had satellite TV with CNN, BBC, and SkyNews in English on a wall-mounted flat-screen. The apartment did not offer internet service, however, there is a public internet kiosk next door to the apartment entry offering 30 minutes of access for 1.50 Euro. The bathroom was fully-stocked with amenities, the towels were nice and thick, and the towel-warmer was a nice feature. Never had any problems with availability of hot water. Angelo and his staff were helpful and gracious. In addition, Angelo gave some great recommendations with regard to restaurants, money changing services, and shops in the area. The location was convenient to dining, shopping, and transportation. Everything we needed was within easy walking distance. Less than five minute walk to the main "Termini" train and bus station. The breakfast was good. It provided what you would expect at most European hotels with rolls, cereal, pastries, cheese, sliced deli meats, juice, coffee, and tea. The entrance to the hotel itself looks a bit shop worn, but, don't let the entrance lower your first impression of the hotel. Buildings in Rome are very old, so this is a feature of many properties. We chose to have the hotel set up our transportation to and from the airport. It may have cost a few Euro more, but, it was efficient and hassle free. The driver was waiting for us with a sign that said "Hotel Cortina" and our last name. If you stay here, you should be pleased with the choice. Angelo, thanks for a great stay. If we were coming to Rome tomorrow, we would stay right here, felt like home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Amunds
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this little hotel for four nights with some of my friends. The location is great. You can easily walk to it from Termini, but it is more than a few blocks away. It is easy to find, located on the Via Nazionale street. The first two nights we stayed at the apartment the hotel has around the corner. A great apartment. The last two nights we stayed at the hotel. Room was good size, and also nice size on bathroom. The room had a very nice wooden floor. Very clean. One of our rooms had a view out to the Via Nazionale, the other one to a backyard that was not very exiting. The most extraordinary of this hotel was the staff. Very professional, and they went out of their way to help us out on any request we might have. They fixed tickets for the Rome derby when the company we had used did not deliver. On the final day they left the breakfast out for us since we had been out all night, and needed some food before the trip home. We did not ask for this, it was just something they did to be nice. I must say that I was very surpriced that a hotel would let someone eat one hour after the breakfast normally closed without charging anything extra. They where also very good at describing how to get around to places we wanted to visit. I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: bluebellbris
Reviews.Content: My deaughter and myself had a wonderful stay at the Cortina.The manager, Angelo and his staff made us feel very welcome and went out of thier way to help us in every way possible.The hotel is within easy walking distance of most of the sights and transport in Rome.This is a first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: macraj
Reviews.Content: A short walk from the Termini train station made the location of this hotel very good. The friendly staff, nice rooms, and great breakfast buffet made it a very enjoyable stay. Each morning they posted weather reports, traveller's advisories, and tips for doing things in Rome. We were very impressed with the friendliness and helpfulness of the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: dorelOradea
Reviews.Content: I stay there with my family and i found this place nice and convenient.They offer me an apartment situated in via Modena wich is few meters away from the Hotel.The apartment was clean,large and very comfortable. I think is a best choice for a family of four or five pearson.From that area it is easyear to walk to many other sites.I reccomend this place and i hope to return next year. dor

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wonderfulworld
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location for sightseeing. Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, Piazza Novona, and the Spanish Steps are within walking distance, and it is conveniently located for metro and bus service to other destinations. We were in room #7, which faces busy Via Nationale. However, good windows kept street noise out of the room, and we slept well. Our room was a little larger than some other rooms I saw. The staff was friendly, helpful, and professional. Housekeeping was at a higher standard than we observed in some other hotels, and sheets were changed frequently during our six-night stay. Breakfast was good and it was served in a pleasant room. One act that endeared us to this hotel is that when, suffering from jet lag, we awakened after 11:00 a.m., breakfast was waiting for us though breakfast hours are 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 a.m. Our rate was 172 Euros ($268) a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: sankawa
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay. Good location, near many historical features, vino and food, shopping. My hotel room was pretty comfortable and i enjoyed my breakfast. Very helpfull and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “warmest like a home”
Reviews.Author: benbencheung
Reviews.Content: location is good only walk few minutes to metro,hotel very clean and bed comfortable. staff show warmest smile and helpful, breakfast good,the price reasonable,i highly recommand this is the best hotel i choose when i stay at roma.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cahlan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of every major site in Rome. Other than the Vatican, you can walk just about anywhere in 15-20 minutes. Their is a subway stop at the Republica about 2 blocks up the street that stops right in front of the Vatican. We took this to the Vatican and walked back to the Hotel without any problem. It is also a short walk from the train station if you arrive or depart by train. If you don't get lost like we did, it is only a 5-10 minute walk. We didn't have any problems with noise during our stay. Other reviewers mentioned hearing noise from the pub below, but we didn't notice this at all. They ask you to leave your key at the front desk when you leave, but every time we buzzed in at the door downstairs, they let us in right away, so it was not an inconvenience. The staff is so polite!!One morning we woke up late and didn't make it down to breakfast, so we were planning to head out somewhere and pick something up. On our way out, they asked us if we didn't want breakfast and we said we just woke up to late. They brought the breakfast items back out for us without the least bit of hesitation. The breakfast was very good by European standards. They serve cereal, yogurt, cold meat, fruit, coffee, tea, cheese, bread, and pastries. We really enjoyed our stay here and will definitely stay here again if we return to Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Cortina was OK”
Reviews.Author: tricialynn1112
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Cortina for 1 night. We have a family of 3 (2 adults, 1 child) and I would have to say, the room was very small for the price- as many European hotels are. When I made the reservation on the phone, I spoke to Angelo, whom was very nice and helpful. When we arrived, there were other staff members that were not helpful at all. They couldn't really give a good directions to the popular sites or recommend good restaurants. One thing I thought was strange about the hotel was...they don't allow eating in the rooms...but we did anyways. The breakfast was good...there was a selection compared to other European hotels I've been to. The location was good...it's in the busy street area...just be prepared to walk to the major sites. There is a small elevator and the rooms were quiet (you couldn't hear the outside noise). The closest Metro is about a 15 min walk - from the Metro you can get about anywhere in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: twosean
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to Rome. On my first visit the location of our hotel wasn't great so that was a big factor in choosing Hotel Cortina. As location goes hotel Cortina is ideal. It is on the busy via Nazionale. This is within walking distance of most of the sights within the city and very close to a Metro Station. Also several buses serve this is area. The hotel itself is on the 1st floor of a building. From the moment that we arrived the staff were lovely to us. They really went out of their way to help. On the first night we had a room at the front of the hotel which was very comfortable but we found the noise of the traffic outside kept us awake. We mention this to staff the following morning and were immediately moved to a different room at the back of the building. Both rooms were lovely and spacious and spotlessly clean. Management even left us a complementary little bag of chocolates when we moved rooms. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and was surprisingly good. There was a wide range of foods and staff ensure that there was plenty of everything. Including loads of very good coffee. Right beside Hotel Cortina is a nice Irish Bar where we were able to have a relaxing pint in the evening. My wife and myself were extremely pleased with this hotel and will highly recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: rouli7
Reviews.Content: Greece, 01/2008 + We were 4 persons (2 couples) and we booked the apartment of the hotel Cortina for the Christmas period. The apartment was the perfect choice for us. It was big and BEAUTIFUL!!!!!!!! , consisted of 2 separated bedrooms with each one private bathroom. The kitchen and the living room were also perfect!! We have really enjoyed our stay in the apartment. Sign. Anglelo was very helpful and too polite. We really thank him for all. The breakfast was good. The hotel is only 20 meters from the apartment. Location is also perfect for walking around the city. It is not necessary to use transport. I fully recommend the apartment if you are 4 persons! - The only thing that I don't recommend is the pick-up service from the airport that costs 55 euro. There is a standard price for a taxi that is 40 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: LAR60
Reviews.Content: After checking trip advisor, we chose to stay here. We booked a triple room for 7 nights. A few weeks before departing Australia, we were invited to stay in their apartment for the same price. Wow! It was just around the corner and had two bedrooms/two bathrooms, full kitchen, beautifully furnished, full air-con, double glazing (very quiet), and a lift. Breakfast was still included and is just a few minutes walk around the corner to hotel. There is an internet cafe next to the apartment building and a couple of supermarkets about a five minute walk away. Ristorantes abound and although we ate at the Irish pub downstairs on our first night, we did better at other locations. All staff are exceptionally helpful especially Angelo and Florian - they couldn't do enough to assist. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. It is also centrally located for all sightseeing. Only one thing bothered us - we found the king size bed in the apartment to be rather saggy.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved This Place”
Reviews.Author: deniza
Reviews.Content: What really makes this place is the staff. Without a doubt they are the nicest people. I stayed here with my mother and 2 older ladies, one was visually impaired and the other never traveled before our trip. Needless to say they had a million questions and needed assistance regularly. Florian and Angelo was always at the ready. In addition to helping them, I needed help as well. They even went as far as helping me arrange our Vatican tour, helped me with travel advice to Sorrento and the countless taxies that we needed. Bravo guys and thank you so much! The hotel itself is a small hotel which was a pleasure from the hustle and bustle of the streets in Rome. Totally sound proof except for the church bells from next door. To me that’s not a complaint but rather a bonus. We actually returned to the hotel from our Sorrento excursion. They hotel was gracious enough to let us leave our extra bags and on our return were placed in our rooms. All the rooms were spotless, fresh linens, and ample space. Here is my advice: If you are expecting opulent décor and ornate chandeliers, don’t. If you expect a good value for you money, great staff, clean rooms, and a great location then the Hotel Cortina is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Professional and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: anjilbabi
Reviews.Content: Af ter a lot of research, I booked Hotel Cortina, based on other reviews, location and price. Even after all my research, I wasn't sure what to expect. Hotel Cortina exceeded my expectations. It is a well taken care of property. The rooms are very clean. The metro is close by and the staff is expectional! They are very willing to help with directions, recommendations, reservations, transporation, basically whatever you need. My daughter and I stayed for 3 days, went to Sorrento for 4 days and returned to Hotel Cortina for our last evening. Since we each had a large bag and carry-on and didn't want to travel with so much luggage, we asked if we could leave the carry-ons at the hotel while we were in Sorrento. They were so kind and kept the bags for us. The staff is very pleasant and accommodating. As was mentioned in other reviews, the elevator is small. That is the only negative I experienced. I would definitely stay here again without any hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: JHROrange
Reviews.Content: We were referred to the Hotel Cortina by a nearby hotel that was booked, the Hotel Aberdeen. We stayed at the hotel for two non-consecutive nights (we took off on a two day, one night exploration south of Rome). We stayed in a triplet room one night and the WONDERFUL apartment the second night. We paid 165 euro for the room and 180 euro for the apartment. The apartment is well worth the extra cost!!! I took several photos of the hotel and apartment, but tripadvisor (unfortunately) limits photo size so I could not post my pictures. Suffice to say that one bedroom of the apartment has two twin beds and the other bedroom has a queen or king. Two complete bathrooms. The first night we stayed in Room #4. This room is at the back of the hotel and when we returned briefly in the afternoon, we did hear rennovation work going on behind the room (probably the apartment remodel that other reviewer mentioned). We also were kept awake until about 11 PM with noise from the bar/restaurant area below. Otherwise, room was fine. Customer service at the Cortina was OUTSTANDING!! They called our Italian tour company for us several times as we were getting nervous about late shuttle pick up, they kept our bags for us over night and transferred them to the apartment around the corner. Due to an accident on the freeway, we did not return to Rome until after 11 PM, yet office staff was very courteous about taking us over to the apartment and giving us keys. Then, the absolutely CUTEST young Italian man dressed up in a suit drove us to the airport the next day and we arrived in only 20 minutes (OK, it was early on a Saturday morning, but that guy could drive!). This car service to the airport is only slightly more than the cost of a taxi plus you have the pleasure of a gorgeous driver! Other reviewers have described the location and other qualities of the hotel. We concur. When we return to the Eternal City (I threw my coin into the Trevi Foutain, so I will be back!) we will stay at the apartment of the Hotel Cortina! Ciao!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent eager to please staff!”
Reviews.Author: pmcwhorter
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Europe. Rome was our last stop. We were quite worn out when we arrived. Luckily we had a great experience at the Cortina Hotel. We rented the apartment for the first two nights we were there and it was wonderful. Very nicely furnished with modern updates and so forth. Unfortunately, there was a problem with construction noise in the A.M. beginning about 8:00 A.M. The adjacent apartment was being remodeled. We complained and they called the owner of the apartment. He promised to begin later but next day again promptly at 8:00 A.M. they started drilling again! Why this long story? When we complained again, they took an ample amount of money off our third night's stay. I wasn't expecting this, however, did appreciate their willingness to please! I recommend the apartment for people traveling with another couple or as a family. It's a great deal for the price! It is just about a 5 to 10 minute walk from the train station and metro stop. It is just off a busy street yet quiet!

Reviews.Title: “quaint but very small”
Reviews.Author: shelley26
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 1 night at this hotel. The location is excellent but it is a little hard to find. The entrance is a huge wooden door in the wall and you need to be buzzed in. The lift was something we hadnt come across before so we took the stairs. The staff we professional, the room was clean and breakfast was excellent. It was unusual in design. It appeared to us that they had taken a floor of a building and divided it into sections. Our window looked out onto the laundry and a pile of sheets. the breakfast room was in the middle. soundproofing was non-existant - you could hear everyone walk past. they also had lots of rules - no food in your room, no washing in the bathroom - we were thankful we were only here for one night and had spent majority of our stay in rome in another hotel - but it served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations at Hotel Cortina”
Reviews.Author: sarah4nil
Reviews.Content: We recently had a very enjoyable stay at Hotel Cortina near the Termini. We had a cozy double room which was clean and nicely furnished. Booking directly through the hotel's website was very easy. We were able to walk to/from the Termini with carry-on rolling luggage in about 15 minutes. The hotel felt safe even though it is on a busy street because of the huge door that you had to buzz to get in. It is in a great location - only 5 minutes to the Metro station. The staff was quite courteous and professional. The breakfast was very good, with fresh rolls, ham, salami and cheese, pastries, cereal, orange & grapefruit juice, yogurt, cookies, fresh fruit , coffee/espresso and a dessert-like cake/torte. We would definitely stay there again if we ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Train Station”
Reviews.Author: bkmac
Reviews.Content: My 3 sisters and I stayed in the apartment adjoining the hotel. The apartment was large and clean. The two bathrooms were also modern and nicely appointed. A driver picked us up at the airport on time, and we were met at the apartment by helpful, friendly staff. There's an Irish Pub next door, and we enjoyed being able to enjoy a cocktail so close to the hotel. We would certainly stay here again and highly recommend the apartment to others.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: molly100
Reviews.Content: beautiful old building, great room, very clean, friendly english - speaking staff, walking distance to all sites (trevi -10 mins), highly recommended, mary & john - limerick, ireland (jan '07)

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things that make all the difference”
Reviews.Author: dingoQueensland
Reviews.Content: A very clean and comfortable hotel in a busy city. We were a little concerned when we arrived outside but we were pleasantly surprised when we got to the hotel on the 1st floor. The staff were excellent. They happily made reservations for tours, dinners etc and were a font of local knowledge. The breakfast was very good and there was lots of it. We had a very early flight when leaving and the concierge made the effort to gather us some suitable food that we could eat because we were leaving before the breakfast availability. Its often the little things that make the difference and the Cortina is big on them. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place and wonderful location too”
Reviews.Author: Travellcat
Reviews.Content: The two of us stayed here Nov7-17 '06 and really could not have been more pleased with the location of the hotel(over an Irish pub) and the centrality(two blocks from Republica metro) on Via Nationale, thru the wonderfu old door and up the stairs. The room was fairly small but the bath was great as well as a truly comfortable large bed. Three days in the hotel and then we moved to their apartment around the corner. Now that was excellent, a large two bedroom, two bath, kitchen and livingroom with over 600 channels on the tv if you can figure it out. Load up on refreshments to put in the frig, meaning beer and wine and save a few euros. A microwave to warm your pizza too. Florian and Angelo were great help with almost any info you'd require. The breakfast is fair so you can either save a couple of euros with them or explore any number of places out on the throughfare. The side streets have any number of good restaurants but I highly recommend #16 via del Boschette, Vecchicco Trattoria(spelling?), just plain great and lots of wine to choose from. Anyhow, a great reasonably priced friendly hotel, well located and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: LovesTravlling
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to the apartment around the corner from the hotel. The photos on the website do not do it justice. Its a beautiful large apartment with 2 bedrooms/bathrooms, we even stayed in one night and cooked our own meal which was really nice. It is on a very quite street so we heard no noise at night and it was beside an Irish bar so we didn't have far to go for a few drinks. We were in walking distance to most of the sites, and nearly all the buses stop on via Nazionale. Breakfast was good, selection of cheeses, meats, cereal, juice,bread and fruit and unlimited tea/cappucinos. I would highly recommend this hotel and its staff and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Apartment!”
Reviews.Author: hoosiers2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the apartment offered by Angelo in the street around the corner to the hotel - Via Napoli. It was beautiful! It had recently been renovated and was very clean. I stayed there with my parents and my husband joined us later. There were two bedrooms each with their own bathroom, kitchen and living room. Angelo was very helpful and provided us with a map and some tips. We used the hotel's pick up service from the airport (for an extra EUR 55) and since I was with my parents (60 years old) it was definitely worth every penny. The first night we arrived the taxi driver gave us a nice tour of rome on the way to the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & location”
Reviews.Author: macmungo
Reviews.Content: Fourteen rooms on the second floor of an old building. Rooms are clean, pleasant and even with a certain simple elegance. Breakfast fine. Outstanding service from all the people on duty -- even downloaded sections from guidebooks on places we wanted to visit. Although on a busy street the double-glazed windows assured quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, but wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: rochelle.alexis
Reviews.Content: What everyone says is true.... By the looks of the front of the building and door, we didn't know what we were getting into when we had to buzz to get in and barely fit in the elevator with our luggage. But, that all was erased when we walked into the hotel, where the man who checked us in was wonderful!! Before we could ask the questions, he had a map out, telling us where we could eat dinner and where we could walk that day. He was the nicest man that we had ever met while checking into the hotel. Everything else was OK. The blankets on the bed grossed me out so I slept with a sheet. The mini-fridge was great because we could store our on water and wine there. The breakfast was OK. Corn-flakes and rice-krispes, bread, some sweet breads, cheese and yogurt. No hot food. We thought the location was fine. We love to walk everywhere! From the hotel, we could walk to the Spanish steps in about 10 minutes, we walked to the forum in about 15 minutes, although we took the metro to Vatican City, we walked back to our hotel taking in more of Rome! Luckily, the windows in our room sealed. We tried leaving the window open for fresh air one evening while we got ready for dinner and we couldn't hear each other without shouting. That was a bit annoying, but those are the breaks when staying on a busy street. But, like I said, the windows kept the sound out great when they were closed!!! Although it was a pleasant stay, I don't think we would stay there again. Also, I may recommend it to some of our younger siblings (early 20s) who are traveling through Europe, but we wouldn't tell most of our friends (early 30s) or our parents to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: iloveeuropetoomuch
Reviews.Content: we were upgraded to the apartment which was amazing!! just around the corner from the hotel so the hotel is in a great spot. about 15 mins walk to coluseum and forum. breakfast was ok and staff very friendly. recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: krissypoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cortina for 6 nights and we were very happy with our stay. The hotel offers clean, simple, safe accomodations at a reasonable price. The staff was extremely helpful - they did a great job arranging our hotel pick-ups/drop-offs, recommending restaurants and sights. They lent us Rome tour guides, provided maps, and were knowledgeable about the local bus & train system. We liked having breakfast available everyday, too - there were various options and anyone could find something that they like. The room was spotless. Our bathroom was modern and large w/a full tub & shower. The location might be a little too close to Termini for people who would prefer to have all the sights at their fingertips. However, that type of location in Rome comes with a steep pricetag, so if you don't mind to walk for a few minutes, the location is just fine. The buzzer system to get into the building worked our pefectly. We would recommend the Hotel Cortina to those looking for a reasonably-priced clean and comfortable hotel within walking distance to the sights. The only slight improvements we'd suggest would be add clocks in the rooms and provide ice for the juices & water at the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rushydc
Reviews.Content: You could not pick a more friendly hotel! When we arrived at our hotel to hours before the check in time we expected to leave our bags and come back later, but no!! We had a very warm welcome and could hear the manager hurrying the cleaners to get our room ready!! We booked our room with hotel Cortina after reading reviews on the trip adviser website and what a little gem it is!! The rooms are very very clean and we were given a bottle of bubbly and some chocolates when the management found our we where on our honeymoon!! The location isnt bad and because its on a main road you feel very safe at night. Its great for seeing all the main attractions in Rome! We WILL being going back!!!!! BOOK NOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Zahary
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome during the last European Winter. We did a lot of Italy by rail and found the Hotel's location excellent being only 10 minutes walk (with luggage) from the main rail station. The rooms were small but very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. The location also put us within easy walking distance to many attractions. If you are feeling a bit leg sore the Republica underground rail station is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Cortina 2-bed Apartment”
Reviews.Author: Travel-taker
Reviews.Content: Staff at Hotel Cortina were great - really helpful during booking of accommodation. As there were 4 of us (2 couples), we were offered a 2-bed, 2-bath apartment just round the corner from the hotel for Euro195 per night (including breakfast back at the hotel each morning which consisted of ham/cheese, rolls, pastries, tea/coffee, fruit). They also arranged a return private transfer from Ciampino airport (at Euro55 each way). Apartment on 4th floor, just round the corner from the busy Via Nazionale. Found it to be spacious, well furnished/decorated and quiet, away from traffic noise. Air-con a bonus! Beds really comfortable too!! Found everywhere in Rome easy enough to walk to, with the help of a good map, with the exception of the Vatican which we got a bus to (Termini station close by) - the hotel will advise you of which bus. Just wear comfortable shoes for the uneven pavements and cobblestones. Went at the end of August, found some places to be closed but most were re-opening (August is shut-down/holiday season). Lunch was often a panini, which we all enjoyed, but evening meals were more hit-and-miss - rarely were all our meals served together and quality wasn't always what we expected. On the downside, my purse was snatched on our last day while shopping on Via Cavour where it was really busy. Noticed that, in a split second, someone had unzipped my bag (which was in front of me!) and pulled out my purse! I'm always really careful so felt very shocked and saddened to have this happen. Hotel were helpful when we got back and had the phone numbers to cancel credit cards - apparently it has been happening a lot lately. (Sadly we didn't find the police as helpful.) All in all, we would highly recommend the apartment offered by Hotel Cortina.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: rach9677
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back from a three night trip to Rome with my husband. We were recomended this hotel by a friend and were not disappointed. The hotel is basic but very comfortable. Our room was very small, but adequate. It had air conditioning and an ensuite shower room. The staff were really very friendly and could not do enough for us. We kept on missing breakfast, but they still insisted on giving us a capuccino and a coissant before we left for our sigtseeing for the day. The hotel was centrally located, it is a 10 minute walk from teh main station in Rome and on one of hte main streets which made it in easy reach of all the main tourist attractions of Rome, notibly the Collosuem and Trevi Fountain, to name two. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: pammiejean2
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 day stay at this lovely hotel. The staff were wonderful and really helpful. When the problems at the airports started on Thursday, we were due to travel back to the UK the next day, and they checked airport and news websites for us so we knew what to expect the following day. The hotel itself was really good, very clean, (the shower cubicle in the room we had was VERY compact but managable) the breakfasts were excellent. They even had a daily bulletin advising you of the weather for the day and suggestions of where to eat. The distance from most of the main attractions are walkable, we did take the Metro to the Vatican. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! (I am a rather fussy person too.)

Reviews.Title: “Good location - reasonable rooms”
Reviews.Author: HT1
Reviews.Content: Four of us spent three nights here recently. As previous reviewers have said the hotel is on the second floor of an old building. Staff are very friendly and helpful. We had two rooms and the twin room was larger. Double room was small and had a step between the bedroom and bathroom which could be dangerous. Location is good - seconds from the metro and the main sites are walkable. Found taxis to be good value. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Cortina”
Reviews.Author: crs319
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cortina for 3 nights this past May while in Rome. Our room, while small, was comfortable and spotless. We had a mini-fridge and access to an outdoor patio area. The bathroom was spacious, though getting in and out of the bathtub might be difficult for older travelers or those with limited mobility. This could've just been the case in our room. The hotel is located on the 2nd floor of a nice building with a lift. We found the location to be fine. Public transport very close as well as a convenient taxi stand. We were able to walk to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps areas with no problem. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We were in town while the Italian Open tennis tournament was going on and the conceriege helped us with getting tickets and getting to the venue. Breakfast was great each morning. An assortment of breads, croissants, pastries, juice, and coffee. All in all, we had a great stay at the Hotel Cortina and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fancynanc85
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Cortina was delightful! The staff was extremely helpful in giving us directions prior to our arrival via email, and after we arrived they went out of their way to help us navigate Rome. They directed us to a nearby parking garage for our rental car, and gave us the most efficient route to drop off the car since Rome has many one way streets and heavily congested traffic. The location was excellent and easy to find and within walking distance of many of the major sights. Breastfast was typical Continental but with a wider selection than is offered in most hotels.They even offered to put something aside for us because we departed before they began serving on our last day there! The room was quiet even though it is on a busy street because of the double-paned windows. Though not large, it was very comfortable for three people. The bathroom was spacious and clean.I would highly recommend this little gem to anyone seeking a comfortable stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. My husband and I and another couple stayed at Hotel Cortina for 2 nights. We were a bit nervous at first due to it being on a main street (Via Nazionale) but when we walked in to the little walkway off the street, you couldn't believe that such a beautiful hotel was behind the door. You can use the elevator or stairs up to the first floor. The sights and Termini train station are within walking distance. The staff was very helpful and willing to speak english (but they find in a compliment if you at least try and speak Italian). Continental breakfast was superb. Meats, Cheeses, pastries, a typical european breakfast. Their coffee was out of this world. The noise was not a problem, especially with the a/c on. Our friends did however, have a cat meowing outside their window for a little while. Our rooms were small, but very very comfortable. The husband of the other couple is over 6 feet and he was very comfortable in their room. Take a look at the restaurants that they recommend. They are delicious. I would definately stay here again...Ciao!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Cortina”
Reviews.Author: rpaino
Reviews.Content: Selected this Hotel through Travle Agent and we had a great stay. It's a very nice hotel in a great location of Rome. The Hotel is small (12 rooms) but very clean. The staff are all very helpful and we enjoyed our stay. Do not expect large rooms (it's Europe remember) but they are comfortable enough and clean and practiable bathrooms. I would recommend this hotel in the price range.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Cortina
HotelInfo.Address: Via Nazionale,18, 00184 Rome, Italy
